Efficient Computation in R

Stefano Monti

Source: vignettes/docs/matrixOp.Rmd
matrixOp.Rmd

Here we show a simple example of the gains in efficiency that can be achieved by taking advantage of matrix operations rather than multiple calls to a function.

In this example, we compare three approaches to computing the row sums of a large matrix. In the first (super-inefficient) approach, we make use of a double for loop. In the second (still slow) approach, we make use of the function apply. In the third (most efficient) approach, we make use of the cartesian product operator %*%.

set.seed(123) # for reproducible results
N <- 10000000 # 10^7
X <- matrix(rnorm(N),nrow=N/10,ncol=10) # a 10^6-by-10 matrix

## use of for loop
forSum <- function(X)
{
    rowS <- rep(0,nrow(X))
    for ( i in 1:nrow(X) )
        for ( j in 1:ncol(X) )
            rowS[i] <- rowS[i] + X[i,j]
    return( rowS )
}
T0 <- system.time(tmp0 <- forSum(X))
print(T0)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   1.367   0.016   1.391
## use of apply function
T1 <- system.time(tmp1 <- apply(X,1,sum))
print(T1)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   1.347   0.043   1.450
## use of matrix multiplication
In <- rep(1,10) # define a unit vector
T2 <- system.time(tmp2 <- X %*% In)
print(T2)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.019   0.000   0.019
## let's measure the speed-up
T1["sys.self"]/T2["sys.self"] # CPU
## sys.self 
##      Inf
T1["user.self"]/T2["user.self"] # CPU + R/W
## user.self 
##  70.89474
T0["user.self"]/T2["user.self"] # CPU + R/W
## user.self 
##  71.94737

As you can see, the matrix-based sum achieves an 80-fold speed-up relative to the apply-based implementation, and more than a 600-fold speed-up relative to the for loop-based implementation.

It should be noted that there are actually native R functions for the efficient sum of a matrix rows and columns (rowSums and colSums). However, the point of this basic demonstration holds.

## use of apply function
T3 <- system.time(tmp3 <- apply(X,2,sum))
print(T3)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.109   0.023   0.134
## use of matrix multiplication
In <- rep(1,1000000) # define a unit vector
T4 <- system.time(tmp4 <- t(X) %*% In)
print(T4)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.050   0.022   0.075
## use of matrix multiplication
In <- rep(1,1000000) # define a unit vector
T5 <- system.time(tmp4 <- In %*% X)
print(T5)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.023   0.000   0.024
T6 <- system.time(rowSums(X))
print(T6)
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.029   0.006   0.035
